member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Dge2System2ReservedSigs.DmOutputHdcpStateFeedback
member.summary: Reports the status of HDCP authentication at the corresponding output, as follows: 0d = HDCP not required 1d = Downstream sink (i.e., the DM-TX-201C) not ready 2d = Downstream sink ready 3d = Downstream sink timeout 50d = Unauthenticated 51d = Unauthenticated (maximum HDCP keys exceeded) 52d = Unauthenticated (maximum HDCP device connection levels exceeded) 53d = Authenticated 54d = No downstream sink

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Dge2System2ReservedSigs.DmOutputHdcpErrorStatusFeedback
member.summary: Reports the HDCP error status as follows: 0d = No Error 1d = Maximum HDCP keys exceeded 2d = Link not stable 3d = HDCP unauthenticated

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Dge2System2ReservedSigs.HdmiOutputHdcpStateFeedback
member.summary: Reports the status of HDCP authentication at the corresponding output, as follows: 0d = HDCP not required 1d = Downstream sink (i.e., the DM-TX-201C) not ready 2d = Downstream sink ready 3d = Downstream sink timeout 50d = Unauthenticated 51d = Unauthenticated (maximum HDCP keys exceeded) 52d = Unauthenticated (maximum HDCP device connection levels exceeded) 53d = Authenticated 54d = No downstream sink

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Dge2System2ReservedSigs.HdmiOutputHdcpErrorStatusFeedback
member.summary: Reports the HDCP error status as follows: 0d = No Error 1d = Maximum HDCP keys exceeded 2d = Link not stable 3d = HDCP unauthenticated

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.UnRegister
member.summary:
Unregister this device with the system. This function can not be called from the device's own SigChange event handler.
On successful unregistration, if this device supports the event, it will trigger indicating the device when offline.
member.returns: An enum of type eDeviceRegistrationUnRegistrationResponse.

member.summary: Clean up of resources.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.Feedbacks
member.summary: Property to get the collection of feedbacks with on and active indicators on .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterFakeFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to set and get the Fake Feedback state. When set to true, the LED corresponding to button will fade blink between On LED color and Off LED color at the time, for a minimum of 2 sec, until the or property value is initialized to some other state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterActiveFeedbackBlinkRate
member.summary: Parameter to define the fade blink rate time between the LED On color and LED Off color. Value in seconds (units of 0.01 sec precision) for the blink/fade period of the LEDs when they are in active feedback state. Valid range is from 0.1 to 2 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100. Default value is 0.75 seconds. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Time value in seconds. A press longer than this value triggers a Hold event. A press shorter than this value triggers a Tap or DoubleTap event. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterDoubleTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DoubleTap" to be recognized. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately. false – Tap is reported at the end of every short press, DoubleTap is reported at the end of the second short press. true – Tap reporting is postponed to see if a second tap comes in. In this case only DoubleTap is reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterCustomColorInputType
member.summary: Selects whether the properties in / / / are to be processed as RGB (Red/Green/Blue) or HSV (Hue/Saturation/Value) component values. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterDayNightThresholdSetting
member.summary: Indicates which internal setting to use when device is automatically configured to switch between day and night mode based on sensor reading. Default (0) indicates it uses either the factory default threshold setting or the manually calibrated setting if it was saved at least once. Other preset selections are estimated values based on a typical room brightness setting. Valid values are from 0 to 5. Refer enum for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpBase.ParameterAlternateColorTheme
member.summary: Parameter to select the color theme that is applied to the particular Button Feedback as set by the corresponding (true = Use Alternate Color Theme; false = Use Local Color Theme). If is chosen, then the corresponding , and properties will get processed instead of preset internal color themes that match much of the defined 'local' color themes. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.summary:
Backlight LED Settings present on this device.
This property will trigger with event IDs defined in .

member.summary:

member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit, as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit, as follows: Brightness down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit, as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the Contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit, as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.SaturationUp
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation up by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the upper limit, as follows: Saturation up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.SaturationDown
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation down by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the lower limit, as follows: Saturation down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.HueUp
member.summary: Adjusts the hue up by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the upper or lower limit, as follows: Hue up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeSvidReservedSigs.HueDown
member.summary: Adjusts the hue down by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the lower limit, as follows: Hue down = -32767d

member.summary: Video controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.MoveRight
member.summary: Moves the source image right. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Right = +480d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.MoveLeft
member.summary: Moves the source image left. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Left = -480

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.MoveUp
member.summary: Moves the source image up. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Up = +120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.MoveDown
member.summary: Moves the source image down. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Down = -120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.StretchHorz
member.summary: Stretches the source image horizontally by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the maximum value as follows: Horizontal size = +480d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.ShrinkHorz
member.summary: Shrinks the source image horizontally by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the minimum value as follows: Horizontal size = -480d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.StretchVert
member.summary: Stretches the source image vertically by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the maximum value as follows: Vertical size = +120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.ShrinkVert
member.summary: Shrinks the source image vertically by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the minimum value as follows: Vertical size = -120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.GainRedUp
member.summary: Increases the gain of the red chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the maximum value of +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.GainRedDown
member.summary: Decreases the gain of the red chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the minimum value of -50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.GainGreenUp
member.summary: Increases the gain of the green chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the maximum value of +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.GainGreenDown
member.summary: Decreases the gain of the green chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the minimum value of -50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.GainBlueUp
member.summary: Increases the gain of the blue chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the maximum value of +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.GainBlueDown
member.summary: Decreases the gain of the blue chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the minimum value of -50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.BrightnessUp
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit as follows: Brightness up = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.SyncCoarseMore
member.summary: Increases the coarse sync adjustment by one step. The input has no effect once the coarse sync reaches the maximum value of +480d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.SyncCoarseLess
member.summary: Decreases the coarse sync adjustment by one step. The input has no effect once the coarse sync reaches the minimum value of -480d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.RgbBaseReservedSigs.SyncFineLess

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmRgbReservedSigs.MoveRightFeedback

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmRgbReservedSigs.MoveLeftFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the RGB source image is moving in the indicated direction left. The output remains high for as long as the move command is active.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmRgbReservedSigs.MoveUpFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the RGB source image is moving in the indicated direction up. The output remains high for as long as the move command is active.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmRgbReservedSigs.MoveDownFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the RGB source image is moving in the indicated direction down. The output remains high for as long as the move command is active.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmRgbReservedSigs.StretchHorzFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the RGB source image is being stretched in the horizontal direction. The output remains high for as long as the stretch command is active.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmRgbReservedSigs.ShrinkHorzFeedback

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.BrightnessUp
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit, as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit, as follows: Brightness down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit, as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the Contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit, as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.SaturationUp
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation up by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the upper limit, as follows: Saturation up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.SaturationDown
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation down by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the lower limit, as follows: Saturation down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.HueUp
member.summary: Adjusts the hue up by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the upper or lower limit, as follows: Hue up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.HueDown
member.summary: Adjusts the hue down by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the lower limit, as follows: Hue down = -32767d

member.summary: Sets the brightness of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.Contrast
member.summary: Sets the contrast of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.Saturation
member.summary: Sets the level saturation. Valid values range from -32767d to +32768d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeCompositeReservedSigs.Hue

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioMuteOff
member.summary: Un-mutes (restores) the local audio on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioMuteOn
member.summary: Mutes local audio on the rising edge of the input. Local audio is the internally generated audio from embedded applications (such as Media Player or VoIP Intercom) or the microphone audio on the panel.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.MicOn
member.summary: Mic On

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.MicOff
member.summary: Mic Off

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.KeyClickVolumeUp
member.summary: Raises the key click volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.KeyClickVolumeDown
member.summary: Lowers the key click volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.AudioSrcCHProgramVolumeUp
member.summary: Raises the AUD I/O program audio volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.AudioSrcCHProgramVolumeDown
member.summary: Lowers the AUD I/O program audio volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioVolumeUp
member.summary: Raises the local audio volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioVolumeDown
member.summary: Lowers the local audio volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioBalanceLeft
member.summary: Adjusts the local audio balance toward the Left channel by 1d with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the balance reaches -32768d (full left). If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the balance will auto-adjust until the input goes low or until the limit is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioBalanceRight
member.summary: Adjusts the local audio balance toward the Right channel by 1d with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the balance reaches +32767d (full right). If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the balance will auto-adjust until the input goes low or until the limit is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.SpeakersVolumeUp
member.summary: Raises the speaker volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the maximum volume is reached.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.SpeakersVolumeDown
member.summary: Lowers the speaker volume by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.SpeakersMuteOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that speaker audio is not muted. The output remains high for as long as the speakers are not muted.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.SpeakersMuteOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that speaker audio is muted. The output remains high for as long as the speakers are muted.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.KeyClickOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the key click is on. The output remains high for as long as the key click is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.KeyClickOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the key click is off. The output remains high for as long as the key click is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.AudioSrcCHProgramOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the AUD I/O program audio is on. The output remains high for as long as the audio is enabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.AudioSrcCHProgramOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the AUD I/O program audio is off. The output remains high for as long as the audio is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioMuteOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that local audio is not muted. The output remains high for as long as the audio is not muted.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioMuteOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that local audio is muted. The output remains high for as long as the audio is muted.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12AudioReservedSigs.LocalAudioBalance
member.summary: Sets the local audio balance. Valid values range from -32768d (full Left) to +32767d (full Right). A value of 0d signifies an even balance between left and right.

member.summary: Sets the corresponding volume level from 0d (min volume) to 65535d (max volume).

member.summary: Turns on the program audio L/R channels of QM IN on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioProgramOff
member.summary: Turns off the program audio L/R channels of QM IN on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic1On
member.summary: Turns on the Mic1 channels of QM IN on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic1Off
member.summary: Turns off the Mic1 channels of QM IN on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic2On
member.summary: Turns on the Mic2 channels of QM IN on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic2Off
member.summary: Turns off the Mic2 channels of QM IN on the rising edge of the input.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioProgramVolUp
member.summary: Raises the program volume level by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The volume is applied equally to the Left and Right channels and is adjustable from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB). The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioProgramVolDn
member.summary: Lowers the program volume level by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The volume is applied equally to Left and Right channels and is adjustable from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB). The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic1VolUp
member.summary: Raises the audio mic1 volume level by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The volume is adjustable from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB). The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic1VolDn
member.summary: Lowers the audio mic1 volume level by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The volume is adjustable from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB). A volume of 0% mutes the speech audio. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic2VolUp
member.summary: Raises the Audio Mic2 microphone volume level by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The volume is adjustable from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB). The input has no effect once the volume reaches 100%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds the volume will auto-increment until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 100%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic2VolDn
member.summary: Lowers the audio mic2 volume level by 1% with each rising edge of the input. The volume is adjustable from 0% (-80dB) to 100% (+20dB). A volume of 0% mutes the speech audio. The input has no effect once the volume reaches 0%. If the input remains high for 0.5 seconds volume will auto-decrement until the input goes low or until the volume reaches 0%.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioAutoCompensationDisable
member.summary: Disables automatic audio compensation at QM IN for as long as the input is high. Auto-compensation allows the panel to recall the input source compensation and microphone EQ settings from the QM transmitter. When disabled, no audio settings are recalled from the transmitter.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioAutoCompensationEnable
member.summary: Enables automatic audio compensation at QM IN for as long as the input is high. Auto-compensation allows the panel to recall the input source compensation and microphone EQ settings from the QM transmitter. When disabled, no audio settings are recalled from the transmitter.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioProgramOnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the program audio at QM IN is turned on. The output remains high for as long as program audio is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioProgramOffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the program audio at QM IN is turned off. The output remains high for as long as program audio is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic1OnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the Mic1 channels of QM IN are turned on. The output remains high for as long as mic audio is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic1OffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the Mic1 channels of QM IN are turned off. The output remains high for as long as mic audio is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic2OnFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the Mic2 channels of QM IN are turned on. The output remains high for as long as mic audio is on.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioMic2OffFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the Mic2 channels of QM IN are turned off. The output remains high for as long as mic audio is off.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioAutoCompensationDisableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that automatic audio compensation is disabled.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12QmAudioReservedSigs.QMAudioAutoCompensationEnableFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that automatic audio compensation is enabled.

member.summary: Sets the volume level for the left and right program channels of QM IN.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterAlternateColorTheme
member.summary: Parameter to select the color theme that is applied to the particular Button Feedback as set by the corresponding (true = Use Alternate Color Theme; false = Use Local Color Theme). If is chosen, then the corresponding , and properties will get processed instead of preset internal color themes that match much of the defined 'local' color themes. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterDayNightThresholdSetting
member.summary: Indicates which internal setting to use when device is automatically configured to switch between day and night mode based on sensor reading. Default (0) indicates it uses either the factory default threshold setting or the manually calibrated setting if it was saved at least once. Other preset selections are estimated values based on a typical room brightness setting. Valid values are from 0 to 5. Refer enum for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterCustomColorInputType
member.summary: Selects whether the properties in / / / are to be processed as RGB (Red/Green/Blue) or HSV (Hue/Saturation/Value) component values. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately. false – Tap is reported at the end of every short press, DoubleTap is reported at the end of the second short press. true – Tap reporting is postponed to see if a second tap comes in. In this case only DoubleTap is reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterDoubleTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DoubleTap" to be recognized. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Time value in seconds. A press longer than this value triggers a Hold event. A press shorter than this value triggers a Tap or DoubleTap event. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterActiveFeedbackBlinkRate
member.summary: Parameter to define the fade blink rate time between the LED On color and LED Off color. Value in seconds (units of 0.01 sec precision) for the blink/fade period of the LEDs when they are in active feedback state. Valid range is from 0.1 to 2 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100. Default value is 0.75 seconds. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterFakeFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to set and get the Fake Feedback state. When set to true, the LED corresponding to button will fade blink between On LED color and Off LED color at the time, for a minimum of 2 sec, until the or property value is initialized to some other state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterLocalButtonStatusFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to define what LED(s) are turned on when the load is on (level above zero percent) or off.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.HorizonSupport.HzCommonKeypad.ParameterLocalButtonActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Parameter to define the behavior of the LED(s) when a local button is press to turn on or off a load. LED(s) can either flash, enable, or do nothing, disable. The timing of the blink is set by .
For quick ramps to the preset level or 100% which take place within a second, the LED will flash at least one transition and end up at on or off state. For a manual raise/lower operation where the button is held down, it will continue to flash while the button is held down, but stop once the ramp is completed and ended at the target level.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.summary: Video controls.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.BrightnessUp
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit, as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit, as follows: Brightness down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit, as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the Contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit, as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.SaturationUp
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation up by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the upper limit, as follows: Saturation up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.SaturationDown
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation down by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the lower limit, as follows: Saturation down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.HueUp
member.summary: Adjusts the hue up by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the upper or lower limit, as follows: Hue up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.HueDown
member.summary: Adjusts the hue down by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the lower limit, as follows: Hue down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.Brightness
member.summary: Sets the brightness of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.Contrast
member.summary: Sets the contrast of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.Saturation
member.summary: Sets the level saturation. Valid values range from -32767d to +32768d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeBncReservedSigs.Hue
member.summary: Sets the level hue. Valid values range from -32767d to +32768d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CLWIUISettings.ParameterLEDOnLevel
member.summary: Sets the LED feedback level when the LED is on. Valid values range from 50% to 100%. Default is 100%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CLWIUISettings.ParameterNightLightLevel
member.summary: Sets the level of the LEDs when in night light mode. When set to 0% the night light feature is disabled. When set to a value between 0%-20%, then all LEDs will glow at a low-intensity level when all LEDs are programmed to be off. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage

member.summary: When this property is set 'false', the device will control the slave output line wire to another dimmer or switch. If set to 'true', the device will operate the buttons only as a remote logic (send button state information only). If the is set to , this property has no effect.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpex.ParameterLocalButtonStatusFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to define what LED(s) are turned on when the load is on (level above zero percent) or off.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzKpex.ParameterLocalButtonActiveFeedback
member.summary:
Parameter to define the behavior of the LED(s) when a local button is pressed to turn on or off a load. LED(s) can either flash, enable, or do nothing, disable. The timing of the blink is set by .
For quick ramps to the preset level or 100% which take place within a second, the LED will flash at least one transition and end up at on or off state. For a manual raise/lower operation where the button is held down, it will continue to flash while the button is held down, but stop once the ramp is completed and ended at the target level.
member.exception: Invalid 'value' supplied to parameter. Please refer to for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzSwDimex.SuppressFeedback
member.summary: When set to 'true', the device will send button feedback information based on the selected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzSwDimex.DefeatLocalButtonLogic
member.summary: When set to 'false', the device will control the local load. If set to 'true', the device will operate the buttons only as a remote logic (send button state information only).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzSwDimex.ParameterLocalButton
member.summary: Parameter to specify which button combination/mode this device is set to. This device does not support .
member.exception: Invalid value specified for LocalButton parameter. Please use one of the values defined in .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.IHzSwDimex.ParameterSuppressFeedbackMode
member.summary: Parameter that defines how the property will operate when set to 'true'. It may hold of all feedback and only send the latest snapshot when a button is released, or always send with a predetermined delay.

member.summary: Initialize sigs.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmSetupReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDisplayLocal
member.summary: Selects the local touchpanel for standby timeout, on the rising edge of the input. This means that the standby timeout period will apply only to the local touchpanel.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmSetupReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDisplayQM
member.summary: Indicates that the standby timeout period will apply only to QM OUT. The feedback remains high for as long as QM OUT is selected.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmSetupReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDisplayBoth
member.summary: Selects both the local touchpanel and QM OUT for standby timeout, on the rising edge of the input. This means that the standby timeout period will apply to both video outputs.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmSetupReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDisplayLocalFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the standby timeout period will apply only to the local touchpanel. The feedback remains high for as long as the local touchpanel is selected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmSetupReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDisplayQMFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the standby timeout period will apply only to QM OUT. The feedback remains high for as long as QM OUT is selected.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc15Qm17QmSetupReservedSigs.StandbyTimeoutDisplayBothFeedback
member.summary: Indicates that the standby timeout period will apply to both the local touchpanel and QM OUT. The feedback remains high for as long as both outputs are selected.

member.summary: Recalls the preset for the corresponding QM IN 1 source. A preset consists of the setup properties defined in the "RGB/Video Setup" page and is stored locally in the panel. Valid values range from 1d to 30d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.Hdmi.StreamCec
member.summary:
Get access to the stand alone device's ability to send and receive CEC messages over the HDMI port. Note that the Owner property of the StreamCec object will now point back to the HDMI that owns the port. It used point to the device that owned the HDMI port.
This property will trigger event with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.Hdmi.DisabledByHdcpFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that the corresponding output has been disabled as the result of a failure during HDCP authentication. This occurs when HDCP (High-bandwidth Digital Content Protection) is detected at the input, but the display or other loopback device is not HDCP compliant. This also occurs when the maximum number of display devices that can be used with the video source (based on the application of keys and KSVs) has been exceeded.For more information about keys and KSVs, see HDCP. This is supported for some of the devices only. 'true' = Output disabled by HDCP; 'false' = Output not disabled by HDCP
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.Hdmi.SyncDetectedFeedback
member.summary:
Indicates that video sync levels are detected at the input. The sig remains true for as long as sync is detected.
The event will trigger with for Input Streams.
The event will trigger with for Output Streams.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.Hdmi.HdcpSupportOnFeedback
member.summary: Property to determine if HDCP support is turned on. 'true' = HDCP Support on; 'false' =HDCP Support off This property is supported only for "Am200", "Am300", "Dge100", "DmDge200C", "DmTxRx100Str" and "DmTxRx4k1000Jstr".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.Hdmi.HdcpSupportOffFeedback
member.summary: Property to determine if HDCP support is turned off. 'true' = HDCP Support off; 'false' =HDCP Support on This property is supported only for "Am200", "Am300", "Dge100", "DmDge200C", "DmTxRx100Str" and "DmTxRx4k1000Jstr".

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.HdmiOutStreaming.ForceHdcpEnable
member.summary: Method to force HDCP encryption at the DM output. When enabled, the DM output will have HDCP encryption applied regardless of the HDCP state of the input signal, i.e., even if the source does not provide or require it. This property is not supported by "HdWp4k401C" and "AM-200.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.HdmiOutStreaming.ForceHdcpDisable
member.summary: Method to disable the "force HDCP" encryption setting at the DM output. When disabled (the default mode), HDCP encryption is only applied when the source requires it. This method is not supported by "HdWp4k401C" and "AM-200.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.HdmiOutWithColorSpaceMode.VideoWallMode
member.summary:
Property to specify which portion of the wall image to display in wall mode, where each display in a wall of displays shows a portion of the image. Displays can be laid out in configurations up to 8x8. Each display requires connection to a separate scaler. The wall mode can be specified using the following method: The video portion can be defined using the 4 digit decimal value WHXY where:
W is the width of the wall (number of columns that make up the wall) H is the height of the wall (number of rows) X is the horizontal position of that display on the wall Y is the vertical position of that display on the wall For example, for a 2x2 video wall the upper left would be 2211, the upper right 2221, the lower left 2212 and the lower right 2222. 0 disables the wall mode. This property is supported only by "Dm100xStrBase". This method is not supported for the "HdmiOut" on the "DmNvxE30","DmNvxE30C","DmNvxE31" and "DmNvxE31C" devices.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.HdmiOutWithColorSpaceMode.VideoWallModeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report which portion of the wall image is displayed in wall mode, where each display in a wall of displays shows a portion of the image. Displays can be laid out in configurations up to 8x8. Each display requires connection to a separate scaler. The wall mode can be specified using the following method: The video portion can be defined using the 4 digit decimal value WHXY where:
W is the width of the wall (number of columns that make up the wall) H is the height of the wall (number of rows) X is the horizontal position of that display on the wall Y is the vertical position of that display on the wall For example, for a 2x2 video wall the upper left would be 2211, the upper right 2221, the lower left 2212 and the lower right 2222. 0 disables the wall mode. This property is supported only by "Dm100xStrBase". This method is not supported for the "HdmiOut" on the "DmNvxE30","DmNvxE30C","DmNvxE31" and "DmNvxE31C" devices.

Property to report the horizontal bezel compensation for the scaler. Valid values range from 0 to 500, where 1 = 1 pixel.
The event will trigger with for this feedback. This method is not supported for the "HdmiOut" on the "DmNvxE30","DmNvxE30C","DmNvxE31" and "DmNvxE31C" devices.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.HdmiOutWithColorSpaceMode.eHdcpTransmitterMode.AuthenticateToHighestLevel
member.summary: For devices with scalers, authenticate to the highest level HDCP supported by the downstream device and always maintain sync. This is done regardless of the input side. For devices without scalers, authenticate to syncs highest level encryption when required the input requires encryption.

members.member: Always authenticate to highest and latch (Not possible with non-scalers)
Never authenticate, blank if the input is HDCP encrypted.

Property to report the number of video packets dropped. This property is same as the "NumberOfPacketsDroppedFeedback" in "DmNvxBaseClass".
The event will trigger with for "DmRmc100Str".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.StreamWithRtspPort.StatisticsNumberOfAudioPacketsReceivedFeedback
member.summary:

The event will trigger with for "DmRmc100Str".

The event will trigger with for "DmRmc100Str".

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.DeviceGroup`1.Add(`0)
member.summary: Adds a device to this group. All devices added must be on the same transport (e.g. a controller's Cresnet interface, a controller's RF gateway, an RF gateway). The first device added (either after the device group is created or after all devices have been removed from the group) determines the the group designated transport that all other added devices must be on. Devices must implement the appropriate IGroupableDevice interface (e.g. IGroupableDevice for a ShadeGroup) for device group. Devices cannot be added to separate groups that have the same group ID number. No devices can be at ID 255 on the group designated transport. There can be up to 252 groups on each transport. Devices must be registered after they are added to group. Group ID numbers must be unique per transport. For example if two groups are created with the ID 5 and then one of two different devices that are on the same transport are added added to each group an exception will be thrown with the second add attempt because it will be detected that there is already a group at ID 5 on the transport. At that point the group can either be disposed or another device that is on a different transport can be added to it.
member.param: Device to add.
member.returns: Returns true if the device was added successfully. Returns false if there was an error.
member.exception: Device is null.
Device already added to group.
Device is part of a group that has the same group ID number.
Device already added to six device groups.
"Device not found on group designated transport."
"Device does not implement the correct IGroupableDevice interface for group."
"There is already a group on transport of device passed in that has this group number."
"There is a device at ID 255 on the group designated transport."
"There are already 252 groups on the group designated transport."
member.remarks: This function is thread safe.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.DeviceGroup`1.Remove(`0)
member.summary: Removes a device from the device group.
member.param: Device that is to be removed from this group.
member.returns: Returns true if the device was removed successfully. Returns false if there was an error.
member.exception: Device is null.
Device does not implement appropriate IGroupableDevice interface.
Device not found.
member.remarks: Devices must be unregistered and reregistered when they are removed from a device group.
This function is thread safe.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.#ctor(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates an instance of a shade group. Group ID can be from 1 to 252. Group IDs must be unique per transport. An exception will be thrown when an add is attempted if there is already a group that has this groups's ID and a shade and the shade is on the same transport as the shade that is being added to this group. The exception will be thrown during the add attempt.
member.param: The group ID for this shade group.
member.exception: "The group ID passed in is less than 1 or larger than 252."

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.Open
member.summary: Opens all shades that are in this group at the same time. Will move the shades to the upper limit.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if there are no shades in the group.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.Close
member.summary: Closes all shades that are in this group at the same time. Will move the shades to the lower limit.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if there are no shades in the group.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.Stop
member.summary: Stops all shades that are in this group at the same time. Will stop all shades movement.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if there are no shades in the group.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.Raise
member.summary: Raises shades towards the upper limit or open position.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if there are no shades in the group.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.Lower
member.summary: Moves shades towards the lower limit or closed position.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ShadeGroup.SetPosition
member.summary: Sends all shades that are in this group to a particular position at the same time. Will send the shades to a particular position where 0x0000 is the lower limit and 0xffff corresponds to the upper limit.
member.exception: This exception is thrown if there are no shades in the group.
member.remarks: Raise and lower must be false in order to set the position of the shade.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.BrightnessUp
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit, as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit, as follows: Brightness down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit, as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the Contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit, as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.SaturationUp
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation up by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the upper limit, as follows: Saturation up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.SaturationDown
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation down by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the lower limit, as follows: Saturation down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.HueUp
member.summary: Adjusts the hue up by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the upper or lower limit, as follows: Hue up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcCompositeBaseReservedSigs.HueDown
member.summary: Adjusts the hue down by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the lower limit, as follows: Hue down = -32767d

member.summary: Sets the brightness of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.summary: Initialize the Joins

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12TouchOutReservedSigs.FormatSvidQm
member.summary: Sets the touch output format of the corresponding video source at QM IN and CH IN to "Touch the PC V2" format. Valid values are: 3d = UPDD XP Driver 6d = Remote Annotation Driver Touch the PC allows the panel to control the cursor and mouse functions of an external PC via a Video window object defined in VTPro-e. The PC can be connected to the panel ONLY through an intermediary control system which in turn is connected via a COM port to the PC, and is connected to the panel via Cresnet or Ethernet. (The TPMC-12 has no RS-232 or COM interface.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12TouchOutReservedSigs.FormatSvidCh
member.summary: Sets the touch output format of the corresponding video source at QM IN and CH IN to "Touch the PC V2" format. Valid values are: 3d = UPDD XP Driver 6d = Remote Annotation Driver Touch the PC allows the panel to control the cursor and mouse functions of an external PC via a Video window object defined in VTPro-e. The PC can be connected to the panel ONLY through an intermediary control system which in turn is connected via a COM port to the PC, and is connected to the panel via Cresnet or Ethernet. (The TPMC-12 has no RS-232 or COM interface.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12TouchOutReservedSigs.FormatCompositeQm
member.summary: Sets the touch output format of the corresponding video source at QM IN and CH IN to "Touch the PC V2" format. Valid values are: 3d = UPDD XP Driver 6d = Remote Annotation Driver Touch the PC allows the panel to control the cursor and mouse functions of an external PC via a Video window object defined in VTPro-e. The PC can be connected to the panel ONLY through an intermediary control system which in turn is connected via a COM port to the PC, and is connected to the panel via Cresnet or Ethernet. (The TPMC-12 has no RS-232 or COM interface.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12TouchOutReservedSigs.FormatCompositeCh
member.summary: Sets the touch output format of the corresponding video source at QM IN and CH IN to "Touch the PC V2" format. The PC can be connected to the panel ONLY through an intermediary control system which in turn is connected via a COM port to the PC, and is connected to the panel via Cresnet or Ethernet. (The TPMC-12 has no RS-232 or COM interface.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12TouchOutReservedSigs.DestinationSvidQm
member.summary: Sets the destination for the touch output. Valid values range from 2d to 254d as follows: 2d = Cresnet 3d to 254d = Ethernet Device ID (this value should match the Device ID entered in the IP Table of the panel.) Out of range values are ignored.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.Tpmc12TouchOutReservedSigs.ChannelSvidQm
member.summary: Specifies the target pad area. Pad areas are defined in the Design tab of the properties for a Video object in VTPro-e. The number of pad areas the target supports differs depending on the panel. Valid values range from 0d (Pad Area 1) to 7d (Pad Area 8). A value of 0d should be used for a mouse cursor on a PC using the "UPDD XP Driver" format.

member.summary: Sends the formatted serial mouse control string to the control system. The control system then routes the control string to the external PC. For example, if TouchOut Destination RGB-2 = 2d, then the TPMC touchpanel will send the serial mouse string over Cresnet, and TouchOut String RGB-2 will contain the serial mouse data.

The number of pad areas the target supports differs depending on the panel. Valid values range from 0d (Pad Area 1) to 7d (Pad Area 8). A value of 0d should be used for a PC cursor using the "UPDD XP Driver" format.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.Feedbacks
member.summary: Property to get the collection of feedbacks with on and active indicators on .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterFakeFeedback
member.summary: Parameter to set and get the Fake Feedback state. When set to true, the LED corresponding to button will fade blink between On LED color and Off LED color at the time, for a minimum of 2 sec, until the or property value is initialized to some other state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterActiveFeedbackBlinkRate
member.summary: Parameter to define the fade blink rate time between the LED On color and LED Off color. Value in seconds (units of 0.01 sec precision) for the blink/fade period of the LEDs when they are in active feedback state. Valid range is from 0.1 to 2 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100. Default value is 0.75 seconds. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterHoldTime
member.summary: Time value in seconds. A press longer than this value triggers a Hold event. A press shorter than this value triggers a Tap or DoubleTap event. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterDoubleTapSpeed
member.summary: Returns and sets the time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a "DoubleTap" to be recognized. Use the to convert the seconds to a ushort value or the to convert the ushort value to seconds. Valid range is from 0.2 seconds to 1.0 seconds. 1 second is represented as 100.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterWaitForDoubleTap
member.summary: Returns and sets the setting that determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately. false – Tap is reported at the end of every short press, DoubleTap is reported at the end of the second short press. true – Tap reporting is postponed to see if a second tap comes in. In this case only DoubleTap is reported.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterCustomColorInputType
member.summary: Selects whether the properties in / / / are to be processed as RGB (Red/Green/Blue) or HSV (Hue/Saturation/Value) component values. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterDayNightThresholdSetting
member.summary: Indicates which internal setting to use when device is automatically configured to switch between day and night mode based on sensor reading. Default (0) indicates it uses either the factory default threshold setting or the manually calibrated setting if it was saved at least once. Other preset selections are estimated values based on a typical room brightness setting. Valid values are from 0 to 5. Refer enum for valid values.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.ParameterAlternateColorTheme
member.summary: Parameter to select the color theme that is applied to the particular Button Feedback as set by the corresponding (true = Use Alternate Color Theme; false = Use Local Color Theme). If is chosen, then the corresponding , and properties will get processed instead of preset internal color themes that match much of the defined 'local' color themes. Refer enum for valid values.
member.exception: Throws this exception when tried to set the parameter value to an invalid value.

member.summary: Property to set the brightness of the DayOn LEDs. A set to this property overrides any default brightness settings applied to the DayOn LEDs.

member.summary: Property to set the brightness of the DayOff LEDs. A value set to this property overrides any default brightness settings applied to the DayOff LEDs.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.AmbientLightLevelFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the current ambient light level scaled from 0% to 100% (0-65535). This property is only enabled when value is set to true. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.LocalColorThemeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report the locally set color theme.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.ColorThemeSelectOverride
member.summary:
Property to override the locally saved setting color theme. This setting is lost on power cycle of the device.
This property is not supported for Cresnet Keypads.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.ButtonAlternateFeedback
member.summary: Button Alternate Feedbacks collection. The index in this collection corresponds to items of . Setting to 'true' enables the alternate color theme for the selected feedback. The alternate color theme is set using . Setting to 'false' will cause the selected feedback to use the .

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.EnableManualDayNightTime
member.summary: Setting it to true disables the automatic backlight control and does not use the internal ambient light sensor. The backlight is in full manual control using or methods to switch between day and night modes and , , or properties to set the backlight intensity. When the property value is false, the unit will use the internal light sensor to automatically adjust the backlight intensity. true = Manual backlight adjustment; false = Auto backlight adjustment

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.ReportDayNightTimeFeedbacks
member.summary: Setting this property to true allows the device to send out the and properties upon changing states. Setting this property value to false prevents the and properties from updating. true = Enable day and night time reporting; false = Disable day and night time reporting.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.InDayTimeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the unit is operating in Day Time mode.
The event will trigger with . true = Device day time mode is enabled; false = Device in an inconclusive or invalid state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.InNightTimeFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate that the unit is operating in Night Time mode.
The event will trigger with . true = Device night time mode is enabled; false = Device in an inconclusive or invalid state.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.ReportLightLevel
member.summary: Setting this property value to true allows the device to send out the current analog value of the ambient light sensor through the property. Setting this property value to false prevents the from updating.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.HzKpBase.HzKpcnBacklightLedSettings.LightSensorCalibratedFeedback
member.summary:
Property to report if the unit has been calibrated before.
The event will trigger with .

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.eLocalButtonLogic
member.summary:
For the Horizon EX Keypad, the local button would be driving the slave/aux output wire connected to another dimmer or switch device. This enumeration to define the various 14 possible combinations offered.
For the Horizon EX Lighting products, this enum will define which one of the local buttons always controls the lighting load.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedFeedbackMode
member.summary: Enumeration to define the various LED feedback modes for Horizon devices.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedFeedbackMode.On
member.summary: Default mode. The top LED of a rocker (3 or 5 position) or single button is on when the load level is above zero percent.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedFeedbackMode.Center
member.summary: The center LED of a rocker (3 or 5 position) is on with the load level is above zero percent.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedFeedbackMode.OnOff
member.summary: The top LED of a rocker (3 or 5 position) or single button is on when the load level is above zero percent, otherwise the bottom LED is on.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedFeedbackMode.None
member.summary: No LED will be on to represent the light load level.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedActiveFeedbackMode
member.summary: Enumeration to define if the LEDs will flash to indicate that the light load's level is in transition.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedActiveFeedbackMode.Disabled
member.summary: Disable this feature.

member.name: F:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Keypads.Horizon.eLedActiveFeedbackMode.Enabled
member.summary: Default, enable this feature.

member.summary: The time between the end of the first tap and the start of the second tap for a double tap to be recognized. Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 second.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.IClwiKeypad.ParameterRemoteHoldTime
member.summary: The time that a button must be held before it is recognized as a "Hold" instead of a "Tap". Valid values range from 0.20 to 1.00 second.

member.summary: Determines whether a "Tap" should be sent immediately on the release of the button, or if the unit should wait until a Double Tap event occurs.

member.exception: Value must be between 0 and 100.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.GeneralIO.ICommonOccupancySensorInfo
member.summary: Interface to describe the common Occupancy Sensor Info for GlsOccupancySensorBase, GlsOirCsmExBatt and GlppBase.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.GeneralIO.ICommonOccupancySensorInfo.OccupancyDetectedFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate occupancy status. Value is true when occupancy is detected, value is false when vacancy is detected.
The event will trigger with: GlsOccupancySensorBase.RoomOccupiedFeedbackEventId for GlsOccupancySensorBase devices; GlsOirCsmExBattEventIds.OccupancyStatusReceivedEventId for GlsOirCsmExBatt devices. For GlppBase devices GlppBase.GlppOccupancySensorIrChange event will trigger with GlppEventIds.RoomIsOccupiedFeedbackEventId.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.GeneralIO.ICommonOccupancySensorInfo.RemoteTimeout
member.summary: Property to set timeout remotely.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.GeneralIO.ICommonOccupancySensorInfo.CurrentTimeoutFeedback
member.summary:
Property to indicate which timeout is being used by the sensor.
The event will trigger with: GlsOccupancySensorBase.TimeoutFeedbackEventId for GlsOccupancySensorBase devices; GlsOirCsmExBattEventIds.CurrentTimeoutReceivedEventId for GlsOirCsmExBatt devices. For GlppBase devices GlppBase.GlppOccupancySensorIrChange event will trigger with GlppEventIds.TimeoutFeedbackEventId.

member.summary: This describes the helper used for various discovery and Cresnet operations.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.IDeviceBranchCollection
member.summary: This interface describes a container that is used to store 1 or more objects. It is a container for multiple network segments. The primary device itself, such as the DinCenCn2, would have this interface since it contains the collection of branches.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.IDeviceBranchCollection.Branches
member.summary: This describes the collection of device branches that exist on a device, which can be used to determine what devices are on the branch.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.IInternalBridgeSlots
member.summary: This is an interface used internally so that we may get a CresnetBridgeSlot (i.e. the top level slot that contains other slots which are actually the network devices themselves). It is used when taking a IDeviceBranch from the user-facing device and constructing the internal device Which requires an IInternalBridgeSlots. Note that IBranchDevice and IInternalBridgeSlots do not have anything in common, so it might be reasonable to ask "how can you cast an object of IDeviceBranch as IInternalBridgeSlots"...? The answer is, you're taking the actual bridge leg such as a CresnetBranch (which implements both IDeviceBranch and IInternalBridgeSlots) into a function as IDeviceBranch and casting it as IInternalBridgeSlots, which is legal to do.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.IDeviceBranch
member.summary: This interface is used to describe an object that is a network segment - i.e. it is a collection of devices. Each branch of a device would have this interface.

member.summary: Number for this Branch (i.e. 1 for Leg 1/A, 2 for Leg 2/B, etc.)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.MoveRight
member.summary: Moves the source image right. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Right = +480d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.MoveLeft
member.summary: Moves the source image left. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Left = -480

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.MoveUp
member.summary: Moves the source image up. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Up = +120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.MoveDown
member.summary: Moves the source image down. The input has no effect once the position reaches its limit, as follows: Down = -120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.StretchHorz
member.summary: Stretches the source image horizontally by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the maximum value as follows: Horizontal size = +480d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.ShrinkHorz
member.summary: Shrinks the source image horizontally by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the minimum value as follows: Horizontal size = -480d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.StretchVert
member.summary: Stretches the source image vertically by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the maximum value as follows: Vertical size = +120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.ShrinkVert
member.summary: Shrinks the source image vertically by one step. The input has no effect once the size reaches the minimum value as follows: Vertical size = -120d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.GainRedUp
member.summary: Increases the gain of the red chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the maximum value of +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.GainRedDown
member.summary: Decreases the gain of the red chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the minimum value of -50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.GainGreenUp
member.summary: Increases the gain of the green chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the maximum value of +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.GainGreenDown
member.summary: Decreases the gain of the green chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the minimum value of -50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.GainBlueUp
member.summary: Increases the gain of the blue chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the maximum value of +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.GainBlueDown
member.summary: Decreases the gain of the blue chrominance channel by one step. The input has no effect once the gain reaches the minimum value of -50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.BrightnessUp
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit as follows: Brightness up = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeHdmiReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinLoadBaseClass.LevelIn
member.summary: Property to set the level of the load for a dimmable load. Valid values range from 0% (Off) to 100%. The value is the percentage of the overall range defined by the corresponding and . For non-dimmable loads, this property turns the load on or off.A value of 0% turns the load Off; any value above 0% turns the load On(It is recommended to use 100% for On.) Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage
member.remarks: We recommend using the method to tie this input to the output.In this way, the same analog will control the light and always accurately reflect the current light level on the dimmer.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinLoadBaseClass.LevelOut
member.summary: Reports the unscaled level of the load. This does not change in response to a value being sent by the input. For this reason, the should be set to from the event handler. In this way, one sig will control the light and always accurately reflect the current light level on the dimmer.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinLoadBaseClass.MinLevel
member.summary: Property to set the minimum level of the load. Valid values range from 0% to 45%. Out of range values will clamp the min level to 45%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinLoadBaseClass.MaxLevel
member.summary: Property to set the maximum level of the load Valid values range from 55% to 100%. Out of range values will clamp the min level to 55%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinLoadBaseClass.Number
member.summary: Returns the Load number

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinLoadBaseClass.ParameterOverrideLevel
member.summary: Parameter to set the load level to recall in the event the unit enters override. Valid values range from 0% to 100%, which is the percentage of the overall range defined by the corresponding and inputs. For non-dimmed loads, 0% signifies Off and any value above 0% signifies On. Default is 100%. Use to convert the percentage to a ushort value or to convert the ushort value to percentage
member.remarks: When SimplSharpPro.Lighting.DinAo8.ParameterOverrideControl is set to , the value will only have an effect until new values are saved by the user via the front panel.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinBaseClass`1.NoAcPower
member.summary: Indicates that AC power is not available at the LIVE input. If power is available there, the module will be powered from that AC source; otherwise the module will be powered from Cresnet. The property remains true for as long as AC power is not available at the LIVE input. This is only valid for the Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.Din1Dim4 and Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.Din1Dimu4

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.Lighting.Din.DinBaseClass`1.ParameterOverrideControl
member.summary: Parameter to specify the manner in which the override state is saved to non-volatile memory. When set to , the unit will recall the corresponding Load's level upon entering override (whether manual or external), while disallowing the user from saving new override values at the front panel. When set to , this allows the user to save new override values at the front panel. Upon saving the new values locally, this invalidates the corresponding Load's level.
