member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit, as follows: Brightness down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit, as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the Contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit, as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.SaturationUp
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation up by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the upper limit, as follows: Saturation up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.SaturationDown
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation down by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the lower limit, as follows: Saturation down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.HueUp
member.summary: Adjusts the hue up by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the upper or lower limit, as follows: Hue up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeTpmcSvidBaseReservedSigs.HueDown
member.summary: Adjusts the hue down by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the lower limit, as follows: Hue down = -32767d

member.summary: Function to report all the cresnet devices on the cresnet bridge. This might not work if there are devices with duplicate Id's on the network. Please execute the function to detect if there are duplicate Id's on your network.
member.remarks: On a successful response, the will contain all devices available in the system. The list will be empty if there are no devices in the system. if the function returns a , then one of the reasons could be that there are duplicate Id's on your network. In that case please execute the function.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.ReportDevices
member.summary: Function to report the cresnet devices present on the cresnet bridge. If there are multiple devices at the same Id, then this will just report the first device. Use the DiscoverAllDevices to discover all the cresnet devices (including duplicate Id's) on the cresnet bridge.
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.SendCommandToCresnetBridge(System.String,System.String@)
member.summary: Method to send a console command to the Ethernet/Cresenet Bridge.
member.param: Command to send to the device.
String to store the response from the Ethernet/Cresenet Bridge.
member.returns: True: if the command was sent successfully; False: possible error was returned or the sending of the command timed out.
member.exception: The specified command string is null or empty.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.SendCommandToCresnetBridgeAsync(System.String,Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelperResponseCallBack)
member.summary: Method to send a console command to the Ethernet/Cresenet Bridge and does not wait for the response to be received. When a callback is passed to this the same will be called once the response is received, otherwise the response is discarded. If no response is received from the device then the callback will not be called.
member.param: Command to send to the device.
Callback function to call after the response is received from the device. If this is null the received response will be discarded.
member.exception: The specified command string is null or empty.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.DiscoverAllDevices
member.summary: Function to discover all the devices on the cresnet bridge. This will report devices with duplicate Id's also. This will not report any cresnet devices which are in the loader. Please execute the function to detect those devices.
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.DiscoverAllDevices(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Function to discover all the devices on the cresnet bridge. This will report devices with duplicate Id's also. This will not report any cresnet devices which are in the loader. Please execute the function to detect those devices.
member.param: Parameter to indicate if this was called externally or locally
member.remarks: On a successful response , the DiscoveredElementsList gets populated.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues - enum indicating return value

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.LightAllDevices(Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.LightAndPollDeviceFunctionDelegate)
member.summary: Function to enable Light And Poll on all devices on the cresnet bridge. When StopLightAndPoll is called the call back will get called with a list of the devices that had a button pressed when cresnet bridge was in light and poll mode. This function can be called more than once to add more callbacks to be called when StopLightAndPoll is called.
member.param: User specified callback which is invoked when devices are taken out of light and poll mode.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues Enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Please ensure that only a single instance of the or LightAllDevices is being called at any given time. If not the outcome is nondeterministic. This requires firmware version 1.011.0014 and higher.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.LightDeviceBySpecifiedTouchSettableId(System.UInt32,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.LightAndPollDeviceFunctionDelegate)
member.summary: Function to enable Light And Poll on a specific device based on the touch settable Id. When StopLightAndPoll is called the call back will get called with a list of the devices that had a button pressed when cresnet bridge was in light and poll mode. This function can be called more than once to add more callbacks to be called when StopLightAndPoll is called.
member.param: Touch Settable Id for the specific device to light
User specified callback which is invoked when the device is taken out of Light and poll mode.
member.returns: eCresnetDiscoveryReturnValues Enum indicating failure or success
member.remarks: Please ensure that only a single instance of the or LightDeviceBySpecifiedTouchSettableId is being called at any given time. If not the outcome is nondeterministic. This requires firmware version 1.011.0014 and higher.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.CresnetBridgeHelper.InternalUserInitiatedLightAndPoll(System.String,Crestron.SimplSharp.CrestronCresnetHelper.LightAndPollDeviceFunctionDelegate)
member.summary: Function to do the actual light and poll.
member.param: Command to send.
User specified callback

member.summary: Sets the font size (1d = 1pt). This overrides the font size of the current theme, in both annotation mode and within MediaMarker. The font size for a theme is set in the MediaMarker Preferences, using the Themes tab.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.EffectDelay
member.summary: Sets the delay, in seconds, for the effect to occur after the annotation has been drawn. Valid values range from 0d (0 seconds) to 120d (2 minutes). The default value is 2d (2 seconds).

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.SetAnnotationFontName1
member.summary: Sets the font. This overrides the font of the current theme, in both annotation mode and within MediaMarker. The font for a theme is selected in the MediaMarker Preferences, using the Themes tab. The string is not case-sensitive, and can be any Windows True-Type font name, e.g., Arial, Times New Roman. Windows will automatically best match a font if it doesn't find the requested font.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.SetAnnotationColor1
member.summary: Sets the line color. This overrides the line color of the current theme, in both annotation mode and within MediaMarker. The line color for a theme is set in the MediaMarker Preferences, using the Themes tab. The string format is "R,G,B" with the values separated by commas with no spaces. For example, to set the line color to solid red, the string can be: "255,0,0", or "255.000.000".

For example, to set the fill color to solid red, the string can be: "255,0,0", or "255.000.000".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.SessionFolder
member.summary: Sets the target folder for screen captures. The string should be the full file path of the directory where the screen captures will be saved, e.g., "c:\Crestron\VTPro\Annotations\".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.FramePrefix
member.summary: Sets the frame prefix (the default frame prefix is "Frame"). Frame titles are automatically named by appending a sequential number to the prefix.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.DefaultFileType
member.summary: Sets the default file format for screen captures. The format can be: BMP, JPG, TIF, PNG, GIF or HTML. If an invalid format is sent, the format will default to JPG.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.AnnotationCursorType
member.summary: Sets the cursor type for annotations. Valid strings are as follows: Annotation_Dot.cur (A dot) Annotation_Cross1.cur (A cross) Annotation_Cross2.cur (A slightly larger cross) Annotation_Cross3.cur (Largest cross)

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.ExportGallery
member.summary: Sets the target folder for exporting gallery thumbnail images. The string should be set to the full file path of the directory where the thumbnails will be saved, e.g., "c:\Crestron\VTPro\Frames\Export\".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.ImportGallery
member.summary: Sets the folder from which gallery thumbnail images can be imported into MediaMarker. The string should be set to the full file path of the directory where the thumbnails will be imported from, e.g., "c:\Crestron\VTPro\Frames\Import\".

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.TouchpanelAnnotationReservedSigs.SaveMediaMarkerProject
member.summary: Sets the filename of the current MediaMarker project. All gallery images will be included within this project.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.BrightnessUp
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the upper limit, as follows: Brightness up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.BrightnessDown
member.summary: Adjusts the brightness of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the brightness reaches the lower limit, as follows: Brightness down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.ContrastUp
member.summary: Adjusts the contrast of the source image up by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the upper limit, as follows: Contrast up = +50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.ContrastDown
member.summary: Adjusts the Contrast of the source image down by one step. The input has no effect once the contrast reaches the lower limit, as follows: Contrast down = -50d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.SaturationUp
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation up by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the upper limit, as follows: Saturation up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.SaturationDown
member.summary: Adjusts the saturation down by one step. The input has no effect once the saturation reaches the lower limit, as follows: Saturation down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.HueUp
member.summary: Adjusts the hue up by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the upper or lower limit, as follows: Hue up = +32768d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.HueDown
member.summary: Adjusts the hue down by one step. The input has no effect once the hue reaches the lower limit, as follows: Hue down = -32767d

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.Brightness
member.summary: Sets the brightness of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.Contrast
member.summary: Sets the contrast of the source image. Valid values range from -50d to +50d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.Saturation
member.summary: Sets the level saturation. Valid values range from -32767d to +32768d.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.UI.DgeComponentReservedSigs.Hue
member.summary: Sets the level hue. Valid values range from -32767d to +32768d.

member.name: T:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.SimplSharpDeviceHelper
member.summary: Class of static helper methods to aid in device communication.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.SimplSharpDeviceHelper.PercentToUshort(System.Single)
member.summary: Method to convert percentages to valid ushort value the device can understand. This does
member.param: A float value from 0.000 to 100.000
member.returns: Ushort value ranging from 0 to 65535 according to the formula Math.Round(65535 * (percentToConvert * 0.01)), with clipping to 65535 on an overflow.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UshortToPercent(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Method to convert from a Ushort to a percentage.
member.param: A ushort value ranging from 0 to 65535.
member.returns: A float value from 0.000 to 100.000 according to the formula This follows the formula ((paramUshort / 65535.0) * 100).

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.SimplSharpDeviceHelper.SecondsToUshort(System.Single)
member.summary: Method to convert seconds to a valid integer value the device can understand.
member.param: Time, in seconds, to convert to a integer value.
member.returns: Integer value that can be passed to a device as a valid time.

member.name: M:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.SimplSharpDeviceHelper.UshortToSeconds(System.UInt16)
member.summary: Method to convert a raw integer value that represents seconds to a double.
member.param: Device Integer value to convert.
member.returns: Integer value that can be passed to the user as seconds.

member.remarks: 'true' = test is in progress, 'false' = no test in progress.

member.summary:
Flag to indicate that all branch testing has completed.

member.name: P:Crestron.SimplSharpPro.DeviceSupport.ICresnetBridge.OverTemperatureFeedback
member.summary:
Flag to indicate that the device is running over safe temperature ratings.
The event will trigger with .
member.remarks: 'true' = device is running over temperature, 'false' = device is within normal temperature.
